question: The marked price of an article is Rs. 500. It is sold at successive discount of 20% and 10%. The selling price of the article (in rupees) is :
explanation:
Equilant discount of successive discount of 20% and 10% 
$latex =\\left ( 20+10-\\frac{20\\times 10}{100} \\right )&s=1$%=28%
âˆ´ Selling price = (100 - 28)% of Rs. 500 = 72% of 500 
$latex =\\frac{500\\times 72}{100}=Rs. 360&s=1$
Hence option [A] is the right answer.
